Talk_0206_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_00>If only our Breezer had a proper <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:1:0>
But if wishes were fishes, eh?
Talk_0601_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease_01>But for that, we'd need <clr:0000>Eustus<clr:ffff>, and you'll
notice he isn't here.
Talk_0622:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>What's this?! <sp:5:0:0>You found Eustus?! <sp:5:1:0>He's
down in a hole somewhere around
Tabantha Great Bridge?!<sp:0:4:0>Good heavens. <sp:5:0:0>What a sorry predicament!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00>I wish I could help him, but I couldn't claw
my way out of a puddle. <sp:5:0:0>No, I'd only make
things worse for the boy.<sp:0:4:0>All I can do is stay put and pray that
Eustus returns to us in one piece.
Talk_0310:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_00>All right, then. We're going back to the
stable. We'll borrow this horse. And don't
you worry—we'll return this noble steed.
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>From the bottom of our hearts, thank you!
Talk_0623:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>All I can do is wait and hope that <clr:0000>Eustus<clr:ffff>
makes his way out of that hole that's
somewhere near Tabantha Great Bridge.
Talk_0311:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Right then, it's back to the stable we go.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you!
Talk_0500:
<sp:3:0:2:0201>We'll return to the stable for now. <sp:5:0:0>Nothing
to do but start again!
Talk_0501:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Hm? <sp:5:0:0>Wait... <sp:5:0:0>What's this?!


Perhaps I'm just imagining things, but
aren't we going in the wrong direction?
Talk_0502:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM_00>Wait! Halt! Stop!<sp:5:0:0> I'm certain I'm not
imagining things!

<sp:3:0:2:0901>Where are you taking us? We'll never get
to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> if we go this way!
Talk_0316:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>The captivating Mija is now at peace!


<sp:3:0:2:0000>But she wasn't the only Great Fairy shut
away in a flower bud.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's why the show must go on...to the
next Great Fairy's hiding place!
Talk_0503: <sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Eh? We can't ride the Breezer like this!
Talk_0317:
Oh, yes! I'll be borrowing this horse so
that I can get to the next destination.

<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:LaughS>But it won't cause you any trouble. We'll
do the responsible thing and return your
steed to a stable. Don't you worry!
Talk_0504:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease_00>My goodness, that was close.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>Let's calm our jangled nerves with a song.<sp:5:1:0>
We can head off to the Great Fairy once
we've steadied ourselves!
Talk_0210: <sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_00>Oh dear, oh dear...<sp:5:1:0> What are we to do?
Talk_0318: <sp:3:0:2:0800>Well then, good traveler, thank you again!
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Greeting_00>Hm? <sp:5:0:0>Ah!<sp:5:0:0> We meet again!<sp:5:0:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0001>Did you come to see the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>?
Talk_0010_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'd like to depart for the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>'s bud
straightway. Only one small hitch...
Talk_0211:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Greeting_01>♪We've done it!♪ You have our thanks.<sp:5:1:0>
You've taken us right to where we needed
to be!<sp:0:4:0>All right, everyone! <sp:5:0:0>No time to dawdle.<sp:5:1:0>
Strike up the band! Our audience is the
<clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> herself!
Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>Yes, indeed! <sp:5:0:0>The <clr:0000>Great Fairy Mija<clr:ffff> settled
close to Snowfield Stable.
Talk_0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>I'm curious...<sp:5:1:0>did you stop by to visit the
<clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> in these parts?
Talk_302:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>She's around here somewh— Look!<sp:5:1:0>
Over there!
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>No? What kind of answer is that?<sp:5:1:0> But...
Wait a moment!

<sp:3:0:2:0001>It must be fate that we met again. And
fate must want you to hear what I have
to say!<sp:5:0:0>
You see, a <clr:0000>Great Fairy <clr:ffff>has settled close to
Snowfield Stable.
Talk_303:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_00>In the foothills of the mountain. Look for
the <clr:0000>green flower bud<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0211_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:CallFar_00>Oh Great Fairyyy! <sp:5:1:0>The Stable Trotters
have arrived!
Talk_304: <sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_00>So close... If only we could reach her.
Talk_0503_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Roof or no roof, we won't get anywhere if
we can't even <clr:0000>board<clr:ffff> the cart.
Talk_0010_00_01: <snd:Notice_00>Can you see it through the snow?
Talk_0202_00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>The <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> has shut herself inside
a flower bud on that mountain.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>This Great Fairy appreciates the unique
tones of <clr:0000>Eustus's<clr:ffff> <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff>, so I thought we'd
coax her out with his soothing tootles.
Talk_0010_00_02: <snd:Notice_00>Can you still see it this late at night?
Talk_307: <sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Notice_01>Was there something you wanted to say?
Talk_0300:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:QuestionNormal_00>What?! You mean all the way back to the
tent at the stable?

<sp:3:0:2:0001>No, no, you're the conductor here.
No need to explain.

<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting_00>We'll wait at the stable until the trouble
is over.
Talk_0301:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_00>Oh, good!<sp:5:0:0> I worried there was some kind
of trouble.

Then please, let's go to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>
as soon as we can!
Talk_0006_01:
<clr:0000>Eustus<clr:ffff> is a young man who plays the horn
for us Stable Trotters.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_01>But one day, he split off from the troupe,
and no one's seen him since.
Talk_0304:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>The <clr:0000>Great Fairy <clr:ffff>has returned to us!<sp:5:0:0>
This...this is one of the greatest days
of my life...
Talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Alas, <sp:5:0:0>the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> is hiding inside her
flower bud.

She's too frightened to come out, just like
her sister at Woodland Stable.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>This Great Fairy always liked the timbre of
<clr:0000>Eustus's<clr:ffff> <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff>, so I thought to calm her
nerves with his soothing tootles.
Talk_0006_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_01>There was one traveler who came from
<clr:0000>Tabantha Bridge Stable<clr:ffff> far south of here
who heard a sound like a <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff>.
It came from a place well past the other
end of the <clr:0000>Tabantha Great Bridge<clr:ffff>,
somewhere along that road.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_00>But that's so far away! <sp:5:1:0>Oh, Eustus, where
could you have gone?
Talk_0305:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>The <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> herself enjoyed my
humble horn playing. <sp:5:1:0>What a day!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>What a divine presence! What splendor!<sp:5:0:0>
I will remember this moment all my life.
Talk_0210_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Ease_01>I want to spread the joy of our troupe's
musical stylings to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> too.
Talk_0306:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:LaughS_00>We can't hang around all day!


We must return to the stable to share the
good news!
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Angry_01>Our Breezer's roof is broken, so we'd be
at the mercy of the elements. Imagine if
we were caught in the snow!
Why, we might fall ill, and how could we
perform at our best then?
Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_01>If we can't put a roof on Breezer, <sp:5:0:0>our
performance for the <clr:0000>Great Fairy <clr:ffff>is as
good as canceled!
Talk_0308:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_00>Oopsie, that's left the old wallet pretty
light.<sp:5:1:0> But that's no excuse to skimp on
our thanks.
A clear conscience is worth every rupee!
Talk_0700:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Now that Eustus is here, we can bring the
sound of his horn to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>!<sp:0:4:0>It would be wonderful if we could go and
perform for her right away.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0201>But of course, there's always something
holding up the show!
Talk_0309:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Thank you!<sp:5:0:0> ♪Again!♪


Which leaves only...<sp:5:0:0>your reward! Now,
now. Don't be shy!
Talk_0202:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Did I hear you say you'll take us to where
the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> awaits?!
Talk_0012_01:
I did try to attach a<clr:0000> roof<clr:ffff> to Breezer.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>Alas, I couldn't reach high enough to do
more than set up some posts.
Talk1006:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>We simply must put on a performance for
the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>. Our music will be just the
thing to encourage her out of her bud.<sp:5:0:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0001>But with the roof of our Breezer in
disrepair, we can't reach her.
Talk_0203:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease_01>Ah. I appreciate the sentiment, but our
Breezer needs <clr:0000>a roof to keep off the snow<clr:ffff>
before we can get to the Great Fairy.
Talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Angry_01>Our Breezer's roof is broken, so we'd be
at the mercy of the elements. Just look at
all the snow falling!
We might fall ill in such weather, and how
could we perform at our best then?
Talk1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>I wish we could outfit our Breezer with a
<clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff> somehow in order to make the trip
to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>.
Talk1008:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>I'm eager to perform for the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>
and show her the world isn't all bad.
Talk_0205:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice_00>Eh? <sp:5:1:0>Where's our Breezer?! <sp:5:1:0>How are we
supposed to get to the Great Fairy now?
Talk_0206:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>Wonderful! <sp:5:0:0>Now that our Breezer has a
<clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff>, I'd very much appreciate a ride.
Talk_0410:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>Stop it! Let me off! Help!<sp:5:0:0> I'm falling!
This isn't sa— What's happening?! Help!
Talk_0207:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM_00>But for that, we'd have to—<sp:5:0:0> What's this?!<sp:5:0:0>
Our Breezer has been fitted with a <clr:0000>roof<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0208:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>♪The world hasn't abandoned us!
I'll never forget your kindness!♪

<sp:3:0:2:0001>I accept your offer. All aboard, everyone!
Talk_0209:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>We're all aboard!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0>The road to the Great Fairy starts by
<clr:0000>going around from the left<clr:ffff> and climbing
a little ways up the mountain.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Greeting_01>I leave the rest to you, good sir!
Talk_0601:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>Alas, the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> here has closed
herself off to the world and remains
inside her flower bud.<sp:5:0:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0701>This Great Fairy always liked the timbre of
<clr:0000>Eustus's<clr:ffff> <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff>, so I thought to calm her
nerves with his soothing tootles.
Talk_0602:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:0000>Eustus <clr:ffff>is really the key element here,
and he's nowhere to be found.
Talk_0206_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Ease_01>Although... <sp:5:0:0>That roof as it is now makes
me uneasy. <sp:5:1:0>Would it be possible to
<clr:0000>expand it a bit<clr:ffff>?
